result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey Lee Johnson

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

4:06 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Jeffrey Lee Johnson in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Jeffrey Lee Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF31 (PLEAS), 22CF189 (PLEAS), & 22CF714 (STC).  Court reviews file and appoints Atty Schutte on 22CF714.  ADA Smestad states there is no longer a resolution, COMPAS assessment didn't come back as expected, asking to schedule this matter out.  DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 4:08 PM. bph
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:30 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Jeffrey Lee Johnson in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Jeffrey Lee Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF31 & 22CF189- set for PLEAS.  Court reviews file. Atty Schutte states DE needs to complete COMPAS DE has rescheduled COMPAS for October, asking to rescheduled PLEAS for a different date after COMPAS.  ADA Smestad may have a conflict he's to update court if date needs to be rescheduled. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 11:34 AM. bph

8:33 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeffrey Lee Johnson in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Jeffrey Lee Johnson. Includes 22CF31 & 22CF189 set for PLEAS.  Court reviews file.  ADA Smestad states DE needs to complete COMPAS still.  Atty Schutte makes statements requesting for a little more time before taking a PLEAS.  DE to go to JSC to schedule COMPAS.  DE confirms address and updates phone number. Adjourned at 8:36 AM. bph
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 11:30 am.

- **AMENDED**

 - Includes 22CF31 & 22CF189

- $500 already on file in 22CF31

- Maintain any current mental health treatment including taking all prescribed medications

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Robby J and Constance J.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

- Once Defendant is released he is to call in to JSC (715-245-4109) ONE time per week to verify and confirm address
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:42 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: A.W. Schutte, DF: Jeffrey Lee Johnson appeared from jail.  Includes 22CF31 & 22CF189.  Court reviews files and notes bond request modification.  Atty Schutte makes argument, believes DE has a hold in Pierce Co and in another County.  State does not object to amending bond.  DE verified address and phone number.  DE can appear by zoom if in custody, if not in custody DE has to be in person. Adjourned at 11:53 AM  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

09:33 AM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY:  A.W. Schutte, DF: Jeffrey Lee Johnson appeared from jail. INCLUDES 22CF31 and 22CF189. Court reviews file, competency evaluation was completed, DE was found competent to proceed. Counsel has reviewed evaluation and stipulate to competency. DE believes he is competent to proceed. Court accepts waiver of counsel and DE and finds DE competent to proceed. Atty. Schutte states that there have been negotiations and requests hearing. Court sets BBH. Adjourned: 9:38 AM. kma  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Court at this time finds good cause and extends, and directs evaluation to be done on or before 5/20/22.  Bond will remain in full form and effect. Adjourned 3:43 PM. bph

02:09 PM  Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad, DF ATTY: A.W. Schutte, DF: Jeffrey Lee Johnson appeared from jail.  Includes 22CF31 & 22CF189.  Court reviews files.  Atty Schutte states he has not been appointed to 22CF189.  DE does not have a job and thinks he'll qualify for PD, Atty Schutte states regardless he will take both files. DE to put his name on the list to see the PD tomorrow and directs DE to inform them he has an atty assigned. On 22CF189 Court will find good cause given the complication of DE's status and warrant out of a different county.  Court orders competency evaluation to be completed before proceeding.  Adjourned 2:18 PM. bph  Competency hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Competency hearing on May 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Includes 22CF189 & 22CF31. Court reviews file. DE confirmes address and updates phone.  DE does not qualify for PD.  Court quashes warrant in 22CF31.
